meanings.sent1: I will repackage the cookies in a new box.
meanings.sent2: After the holiday season, the store decided to repackage the unsold decorations.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to repackage the disappearing act, but the audience caught on.
meanings.sent4: She decided to repackage her old ideas in a fresh, innovative way.
meanings.sent5: The company had to repackage the faulty products to avoid customer complaints.

meanings.definition: To present or organize in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team will repackage the product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to repackage the lesson for the students who were struggling to understand.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to repackage the traditional dish with a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: The artist was able to repackage her emotions into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The author had to repackage the story to make it more engaging for young readers.
